text: HK FCC Město Lovosice or HK Lovosice is a Czech handball club based in the Lovosice, Czech Republic. == History == The club was founded in 1956 as a women's team. In 1969 the women's club ceases to exist. Club advanced in 1977 to the first Czechoslovak league. In 1982 was built Sportovní hala Chemik. Club played in EHF Cup in 2013. == Team == === Current squad === ; Squad for the 2019-20 season ;Management * Coach Jan Landa ;Goalkeepers *1 Jan Hrdlička * 71 Jiří Günl * 88 Daniel Rangl ;Wingers *7 Miroslav Sýkora *8 Jiří Motl *9 Filip Molejt * 22 Michael Konárik * 45 Jan Heřmanovský * 77 Lukáš Malý ;Line players *2 Karel Holubec * 24 Jiří Semerád ;Backs *5 Jan Kupa * 10 Jiří Bouček * 13 Roman Jelínek * 14 David Bíčiště * 18 Tomáš Barth * 20 Jaroslav Trkovský * 29 Josef Jonáš * 31 David Karlovec * 42 Patrik Stah == Accomplishments == * Czech Handball Extraliga: ** : 2011, 2015 ** : 2006, 2007, 2014 == Europan Records == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: left;" !Season !Competition !Round !Club !Home !Away !Aggregate: |- | rowspan="2" bgcolor="white" |2012-13 | align="center" |EHF Cup | align="center" |R1 | HC Zamet | align="center" |27-23 | align="center" |32-33 | align="center" |59-56 |- | align="center" |EHF Cup | align="center" |R2 | HC Vardar PRO - Skopje | align="center" |25-24 | align="center" |19-36 | align="center" |44-60 |- |} == References == Category:Czech handball clubs Category:Handball clubs established in 1956
